title: Week of Character, Courage & Conscience: Is It Okay To Have Feelings As A First Responder?
description:
Jason is a first responder who witnessed a terrible car accident while off-duty. He finds himself overwhelmed by his feelings, but isn’t sure if this is normal considering his occupation. - Dr. Laura: "A man's man does cry. It hurts to not be able to control disasters in advance."

Do your feelings have no IQ? Email me your thoughts at: drlaura@drlaura.com

Order Dr. Laura's book: "How Could You Do That?!: The Abdication of Character, Courage, and Conscience"

go to > https://www.drlaura.com/compare-books-and-courses-by-dr-laura

To participate on the radio program; call 1-800-Dr-Laura / 1-800-375-2872 or make an appointment - https://www.drlaura.com/make-an-appointment. Become a Dr. Laura Family Member: https://www.drlaura.com/ See https://www.drlaura.com/privacy-policy for privacy information.
